title: Why nerf Morg's W?
body:
It's the least offensive thing in her kit. When's the last time you saw somebody get all pissy about her W? It's not what makes her annoying, or obnoxious to play against. You're only hurting mid lane Morg. And with all the mobility floating around this day and age, mid Morg wasn't exactly broken.

If I were them, I'd have done the opposite. Nerf the duration of her Q or E and buff the crap out of her W. But that's just me.

replies.body:
If anything, this exposes the ability to push Morg's out of mid lane during early level trades, since she'll have to auto minions several times up through W rank 3 (or wait for the caster minions to take some damage before dropping the W, since starting with 41AP @ level 1 from runes + Doran Ring leaves casters with ~10 hp at rank 3 W). It will be interesting to see what kind of win rates Morg will have in top, mid and bot after this happens, and if players can adapt to being a slightly more active and mobile Morg until after their first back. 

For support Morg, I think the issue was more the fact the damage scaled really well when an all in happens level 6. Flash, ult, ignite, hit with a Q and then drop the W. It does rather significant damage at that point, especially when coupled with a teammate attacking. It'll still bring in the gold as easy as ever, just if you want to all in bot now, I hope you've autoed once or twice more before committing to the all-in.

Edit: removed jungle, replaced with bot. -_-.
What are Morg's solo strengths, if not her ability to safely push and sustain? Why is one of her strengths being nerfed, rather than one of her weaknesses (squishy, low burst, slow)?

Morgana greatest strengths is her safety and ability to survive most lanes
However Morgana mid isn't recommended because her damage scales so poorly and this might be a problem against tanks (Black shield is usually great against them.. however Morgana usually can't do much to help take them down given that they have Tenacity which reduce her W damage and her sustained damage just isn't good enough... and the Tanks usually stack armor to survive/deal with the ADC) 

Morgana is like perfect against lane bullies and champions who rely on their lane dominance but tend to not scale all that well
As Morgana will probably be able to deal with the laning phase just fine and Morgana also scales pretty well just because of her incredibly strong utility
Sssooooo... are you agreeing, disagreeing, or just sort of tangentially going on about Morg?

Agreeing of course XD
Lane morgana (top/mid) is fine and shouldn't be nerfed

> [{quoted}](name=Cuix,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=000b0002,timestamp=2015-05-12T00:19:43.387+0000)
>
> What are Morg's solo strengths, if not her ability to safely push and sustain? Why is one of her strengths being nerfed, rather than one of her weaknesses (squishy, low burst, slow)?

she's actually the highest or 2nd highest amongst all ranged champions in like 5 different base stats and her build frequently has abyssal/zhonya's, so she's not really squishy

but she's super slow, has shitty carry potential outside of a 5 man ult against a team that's too stupid to walk in different directions and really sucks in lower elos where people won't follow up on your crowd control

also you can't really 1v1 kill anyone unless you have ignite up or you're stupidly fed

edit: oh, and merc treads + banshees ensures morgana will NEVER kill you

her strengths imo are: lane safety, tower sieging, roaming post 6 and supporting a hypercarry (like how you'd pick a lulu or orianna mid to support a kogmaw late game)

In lane, she's definitely easy to burst down. Good stats for ranged, but she's still a ranged mage, and she doesn't start building tanky items until after d-rings and a mana item typically. Totally agreed on most points, though, which is why this nerf feels weird to me.

Assuming this turns out to be not-so-great for mid morg, do you know if the balance team would be looking to improve Mid morg via some AP ratios or SOMEthing?

I take morg mid BECAUSE I want a safe lane, so if she can't do that for me then what is the point? I thought we wanted a niche carved out for each champ to fit, why can't this be hers?

> Riot Morgageddon: 
> If anything, this exposes the ability to push Morg's out of **mid lane** during early level trades, since she'll have to auto minions several times up through W rank 3 (or wait for the caster minions to take some damage before dropping the W, since starting with 41AP @ level 1 from runes + Doran Ring leaves casters with ~10 hp at rank 3 W). It will be interesting to see what kind of win rates Morg will have in top, mid and bot after this happens, and if players can adapt to being a slightly more active and mobile Morg until after their first back.
> 
> For support Morg, I think the issue was more the fact the damage scaled really well when an all in happens level 6. Flash, ult, ignite, hit with a Q and then drop the W. It does rather significant damage at that point, especially when coupled with a teammate attacking. It'll still bring in the gold as easy as ever, just if you want to all in bot now, I hope you've autoed once or twice more before committing to the all-in.

Well basically it seems like this is a nerf aimed at Mid Morgana's pushing power to force her to auto attack the wave/caster minions... I think it is planned to be not-so-great for mid morg.. so yeah she getting ratio buffs because of it... I am not so sure

I'm aware of that. The point I'm trying to make is that she isn't crowding anyone out at mid currently, and directly nerfing this thing that I pick her for (her STRENGTH) doesn't seem to be the way to go about this.

Riot is usually more about nerfing weaknesses than strengths, so this method doesn't make any sense.

I'm tried of riot killing viability in the mid lane because they can't figure out how to balance support playstyles. Maybe try buffing ACTUAL supports so that they can compete with the morg/annie/whatever mage we're taking bottom nowadays.

Oh I totaly agree that Mid/top lane Morgana is just fine as she has very low kill pressure and her damage doesn't scale well and her damage is totally avoidable (she pretty much can't kill you if you avoid her Q and she almost always need to hit 2 or 3 Q's before being able to kill you)

However she is good at being safe and pushing the wave and she is good against lanes you don't want to feed
So she clearly aren't really pushing anyone out of mid

>It will be interesting to see what kind of win rates Morg will have in top, mid and jungle after this happens,

You guys support jungle Morg? And I thought I was the only one! :D

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=000b0001,timestamp=2015-05-12T00:13:50.599+0000)
>
> You guys support jungle Morg? And I thought I was the only one! :D

i play jungle morgana as well

kinda shitty if you're playing against a lee sin or something but it's not too bad against a nunu/sej/gragas
really useful if the enemy has an AP mid. Morg's idea of a gank is to walk up, spellshield, and see what happens.

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=000b000100010000,timestamp=2015-05-12T00:19:59.301+0000)
>
> really useful if the enemy has an AP mid. Morg's idea of a gank is to walk up, spellshield, and see what happens.

i usually just take qw at level 2 and start red, come behind the enemy mid through the banana brush and start autoing them for the slow -> easy binding for the kill or force a flash

> [{quoted}](name=tombdragon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=000b0001,timestamp=2015-05-12T00:13:50.599+0000)
>
> You guys support jungle Morg? And I thought I was the only one! :D

Nope, that's me thinking about too many things at once. Should read bot, gonna change it to make it correct.
So jungle Morgana isn't a thing... :'(
actually, it is. she still clears decently well and as they donßt intend to nerf her death-sentence apparently you´ll still get a kill for every binding.
Before everyone explodes, I think "push Morg's out of mid lane" refers to zoning and forcing Morgana players to recall. Not removing Morgana's ability to play in mid lane

> [{quoted}](name=djjomon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=000b000b,timestamp=2015-05-12T21:05:53.251+0000)
>
> Before everyone explodes, I think "push Morg's out of mid lane" refers to zoning and forcing Morgana players to recall. Not removing Morgana's ability to play in mid lane

Amounts to the same thing, because she is extremely weak 1v1 and thus cannot break the zoning unless she lands a lucky binding. Failure to land a binding means she is truely out of options for far too long due to its long cool down.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Morgageddon,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=000b,timestamp=2015-05-11T23:28:47.394+0000)
>
> If anything, this exposes the ability to push Morg's out of mid lane during early level trades, since she'll have to auto minions several times up through W rank 3 (or wait for the caster minions to take some damage before dropping the W, since starting with 41AP @ level 1 from runes + Doran Ring leaves casters with ~10 hp at rank 3 W). It will be interesting to see what kind of win rates Morg will have in top, mid and bot after this happens, and if players can adapt to being a slightly more active and mobile Morg until after their first back. 
> 
> For support Morg, I think the issue was more the fact the damage scaled really well when an all in happens level 6. Flash, ult, ignite, hit with a Q and then drop the W. It does rather significant damage at that point, especially when coupled with a teammate attacking. It'll still bring in the gold as easy as ever, just if you want to all in bot now, I hope you've autoed once or twice more before committing to the all-in.
> 
> Edit: removed jungle, replaced with bot. -_-.

Surely if you want a more active Morg in mid you could at least increase her AA range. I don't get how you can want her to be being more interactive with enemy champs when she's so easy to harass before she gets into her AA range.
aa range, aa strengh, aa speed, so many small improvement they can make to make her feel better as a solo-laner

> [{quoted}](name=MotherTeresa1910,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=000b0003,timestamp=2015-05-12T01:51:49.036+0000)
>
> Surely if you want a more active Morg in mid you could at least increase her AA range. I don't get how you can want her to be being more interactive with enemy champs when she's so easy to harass before she gets into her AA range.

yes please

Besides the fact that her W is so easy to avoid, and even a maxed Q will only guarantee half of the Ws damage goes off, it has a huge mana cost. I seriously don't understand why they'd nerf anything about morgana. She has enormous cooldowns and her Q is one of if not the slowest moving skillshot in the game and it can't move through minions. She burns through mana and her kit is clunky but balanced. By clunky I mean she has to land Q to make her W do anything at all, and she has to be in melee range for her ult to work.

Absolutely unworthy of a nerf.

To be fair her Q and E are two of the most powerful abilities in the game. Nerfing her W is probably another attempt by riot to nerf a champion without touching their "core strengths" I.E. her utility spells, since support Morgana is what it's all about nowadays. I can only imagine that the more traction she gains as a support, the more she'll be pushed out of any other roles where she's viable. {{champion:37}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:12}}

The whole point of her having a powerful kit is that 100% of it is dodgeable (excluding half of her ultimate which doesn't even stun if they get out of the tether in time). That power comes at the price of being a gamble. Half of the skillcap of Morg is the player throwing the shots and the other half if the enemy having like 2 seconds to move out of the way from her turtle speed Q.

Her E is pretty hard to play around, it's often just a "My friend gets free reign and you can't do anything about it" button. Aside from that, though, I agree with you. However, I believe the general opinion at riot is that being difficult to play shouldn't mean a champion's maximum potential is higher, so skillshot based champions become a somewhat tricky balance issue.

It is has a long cooldown and in lane it is usually weak and easy to break like Thresh can potentially just break it with his auto attack if has "charged" it up or Flay (E) + Auto attack if needed be

Though of course if it is used before the CC... then the best thing is usually just to wait for it to wear off and go in when Morg still has it on cooldown

This. Black shield has a longer cooldown than any cc basic ability in the game to my knowledge. Morg just Black shielded thresh's hook? Try again in 8 seconds when her shield will still have 12 seconds left of cooldown.

Oh and there is also the fact that her Q while it lasting a long time... it is still a snare so you are still able to fight back (given you aren't hit by it while standing in a really bad spot and that you have the range to fight back)

Or fun fact if you are Jarvan you can E + Q (as both can be used while snared/rooted)

And tenacity and other CC removal or reduction abilities reduce her W damage (well not like W damage matters much to support Morg... but yeah)
{{item:3303}} is probably partially the reason. It's stupid easy to proc the passive on it. Morgana should probably be considered for a rework due to a dated kit.

It's still as easy to proc Tribute with it though, it's just worse for actually dealing damage.

Support Morg however, isn't there to deal huge amounts of damage and clear waves with her W like Mid Morg. She's there to eventually hit her binding and use black shield to keep her and her lane partner safe.

Mid Morg however, relies on her W for a good amount of her kill potential and all of her waveclear.

It's semi-unreliable enough as it is, losing her CS to minions between ticks.

riot hates immobile champions

reason why morgana and annie are getting nerfed for being able to challenge the mobility meta

Except in Morg's case, she's much more punishing to immobile champions than mobile ones. If you're an ADC that doesn't have a dash then you're easy gold for a Morg, but if you're playing someone like Lucian? Just dash out of the way of that slow moving snare, easy peasy.
Lol every time Annie gets a love tap on the wrist, she gets 3 buffs to compensate because Riot doesn't hurt little girls...

> [{quoted}](name=Aeolian Melodies,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=00020001,timestamp=2015-05-11T21:00:48.609+0000)
>
> Lol every time Annie gets a love tap on the wrist, she gets 3 buffs to compensate because Riot doesn't hurt little girls...

I don't see any buff for her on the PBE.

> [{quoted}](name=Kappadin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2015-05-11T07:07:37.546+0000)
>
> riot hates immobile champions
> 
> reason why morgana and annie are getting nerfed for being able to challenge the mobility meta

This shit right here, this fucking shit right here. Fuck mobility meta. Il take tank meta over mobility meta any day.
I think the idea is 'nerf her weaknesses and keep her strengths'. So they don't want her to be great at waveclear, but they want her to keep her single target CC and anti-CC capability.

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-05-11T20:38:08.717+0000)
>
> I think the idea is 'nerf her weaknesses and keep her strengths'. So they don't want her to be great at waveclear, but they want her to keep her single target CC and anti-CC capability.

so how does she cs at all?  her auto attack speed and auto attack wind up is abysmal and her attack range is only 450, much lower than other mids.

if i walk anywhere near my cs in my mmr as morgana, i get slapped with a full rotation of spells

Well, she's primarily being played as support, so that's not as much of an issue for them.

Her auto animation isn't that bad, and if you get hit by everything when you walk up to auto...get better at dodging.

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=000900000000,timestamp=2015-05-11T23:33:04.294+0000)
>
> Well, she's primarily being played as support, so that's not as much of an issue for them.
> 
> Her auto animation isn't that bad, and if you get hit by everything when you walk up to auto...get better at dodging.

Her auto attack range is 450.  I have to be literally inside the minion wave to attack the enemy minions.  It's not about dodging, it's about the fact that most mids have pass through/over linear skillshot harass that can easily hit you

Not sure if you're aware of this, but 100 extra auto attack range is a significant amount.  Enough for the enemy mid to freely auto attack me while I try to cs

Then don't be inside the wave? Come in from the side, to force your opponent to choose between hitting you and hitting the minions; either they push the wave and ignore you or try to hurt you and get pushed in.

How on earth did you ever last hit before soil can oneshot the wave?

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=00090000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-12T00:32:05.786+0000)
>
> Then don't be inside the wave? Come in from the side, to force your opponent to choose between hitting you and hitting the minions; either they push the wave and ignore you or try to hurt you and get pushed in.
> 
> How on earth did you ever last hit before soil can oneshot the wave?

I don't know if you've ever tried to cs on a champion with 450 attack range, but no matter what direction you're trying to cs from, you'll be literally next to your own minions OR close enough to the enemy mid that you'll take damage from them 

Also, Morgana's w has always been able to 1 shot the minion wave at rank 3, and rank 2 if you had the right runes/masteries.  There's a reason she has 100 less attack range than all other mages

I play Vlad and used to play solo lane Janna. Considering this is the land of skillshots, the only damage you should be taking while trying to cs is autoattack harass, and unless your enemy is Ori, you should be fine.

And I know that Soil was always used to oneshot the wave. I'm wondering if you simply just missed every CS before 3/5.

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=0009000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-12T00:54:26.030+0000)
>
> I play Vlad and used to play solo lane Janna. Considering this is the land of skillshots, the only damage you should be taking while trying to cs is autoattack harass, and unless your enemy is Ori, you should be fine.
> 
> And I know that Soil was always used to oneshot the wave. I'm wondering if you simply just missed every CS before 3/5.

Abilities deal almost no damage at levels 1-3, so I just tank it until level 3 and then use my spellvamp to get the health back

PS: Many champions out range Orianna, so I'm not sure where you're going with that.
I'm referring to the fact that Orianna is one of the few mages whose autoattack actually hurts.

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=ebdElBuf,comment-id=000900000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2015-05-12T01:42:29.432+0000)
>
> I'm referring to the fact that Orianna is one of the few mages whose autoattack actually hurts.

because eating auto attacks the entire laning phase until level 5 isn't going to hurt
If you're eating autos every time you go in to CS, you're getting massively outplayed, low auto range or not.
